Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Virginia S
Reviews.Content: The best that can be said for this property is the location - convenient to much that we wanted to see in San Diego. However, the mattress sagged in the middle, the towels were thin and a dingy white color, there was no wall art which gave the room a stark appearance, and the TV was an old fashioned one - not the flat screen most hotels now have. The front door was broken so it was propped open, making the lobby and breakfast room quite cold. Some renovation was being done on the hotel's exterior, which created a mess in addition to noise through out the day. Until substantial upgrading has been done, I would avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Dingy Dated Rooms. Horrible Location.”
Reviews.Author: MikeP2K12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for 10 days at the end of January. I was supposed to stay for 60 days but I was smart enough to book in 10 day increments in case I didn't like the property. Here are the pros: 1) Big Rooms 2) Cheap Here are the cons: 1) These are not suites, they are one large room with no separation. 2) The staff is extremely unprofessional. I had an issue with a shower head that I'll get into in a minute. They wear whatever they feel like wearing to work and they are never at the counter. Usually playing on their phones in the back office with a tall wall mirror set against the door so they can see customers. There is absolutely no uniform. Usually skull caps and sweatshirts for the guys. 3) Shower pressure. When I checked in I had no water pressure in my shower. I'm not saying that it was too weak. I mean, none. I just took a bath the first morning. After I got back to the hotel in the afternoon and explained the situation, the guy behind the counter told me that there is construction going on and they're going to fix it eventually but there was nothing that he could do. He didn't even attempt to send a maintenance person to look at the problem. This also happened on Day 3 of my stay. On Day 4, the woman at the front desk sent a maintenance person and they changed out the shower head. Problem solved. 4) Not remotely close to anything. If you don't have a rental car, don't bother. The closest restaurant or bar is about a half mile walk. You are also on top of a hill so you have to walk down a long drive just to get to hotel circle. 5) Didn't feel safe. The property only has one person on duty after 1600 or so. There was no screening of guests. Anybody could just walk in and do whatever they wanted and there is no way the hotel staff can do anything about it. I felt like it was just a home invasion waiting to happen. I really just got the feeling that this hotel is the red headed step-child of Wyndham. It's dirty, dingy, old, unprofessional and just a bad place to stay. Pay a little more and get a better room in a better location. I'm spending the rest of my time at the Crowne Plaza across the street. It's not that much more expensive but the difference couldn't be greater. The management in this hotel needs to be fired or start caring about what it is that they do. I felt as though they had no control of anything. When I wanted to talk to the manager on a couple of occasions I was told that he doesn't get to work until 1100 and that he leaves by 1500. Ridiculous. I read other reviews where people are describing the great beds in the rooms. I was not impressed. My bed was an old mattress with a newer pillow topper placed on it. It did not feel good. I didn't sleep very well due to the fact that the first couple nights I was just waiting for the bed bugs to start attacking me in my sleep. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, little daylight, wifi pitiful, shower not great, need a car for the location”
Reviews.Author: CandV H
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large, but not much daylight. The kitchen is very handy if you don't want to eat out every day. The room and bathroom were clean. Staff were helpful and friendly. Location isn't great if you don't have a car. No noise disturbance from the road or other guests, but the plumbing makes a racket. The shower isn't great though there was always hot water. The gym, though in a very small room, had quite a few machines. The clothes washing machines and dryer were very handy for us. Breakfast would have been more enjoyable if the television in the corner wasn't always on i.e. a constant stream of ads. Wireless, though complementary, is pitiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for room”
Reviews.Author: Ariel B
Reviews.Content: Had a giant room, full kitchen, great bed, so much space I was shocked! The shower was the only complaint and once we didn't get up super early to hit the breakfast bar before they ran out. I didn't have time to wait for more food to come but every other day we woke up early and got plenty of food. Staff was polite and no problems were had. I would leave a note for housekeeping with a tip and all my needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service, horrible showers.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this past weekend 1/22/12 and all I can say is I will never stay at this hotel again. The location and price was right but that was about it. The front desk staff at check in was ok but at checkout the next morning was horrible.First no one was at the desk when I was trying to check out so I rang the bell. Several times. Finally some one cam casually walking up from the side of the lobby, He was not very helpful at all. In fact he seemed as if he was irritated that I was even there. He was very unfriendly and combative.My worst customer experience ever. Besides the service, The room furniture was dated. I stayed in a 2 bedroom suite and the main bedroom had no door. I asked the front desk if there were any rooms that were more private and he said that all the rooms were like that. The tv had been replaced with a small lcd flat screen in the common area but the bedrooms still had conventional tvs.The conventional tvs picture was not very clear. Now onto the bathrooms. Water pressure seemed adequate but the water saving shower head was horrible. I could b arely wash off the soap. It took me forever to shower. In fact I had to turn the shower off and use the faucet to wash off. That was how bad the water pressure was. If your ever going to stay in the hotel circle area I say AVOID this hotel at all costs. I would not stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time visit”
Reviews.Author: catsandra
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd time back within 1 year and they are now remodeling all the rooms and the room we got was beautiful. No pictures on the wall yet but fresh paint and bed and pull out bed on couch very comfortable. We had a 1 bedroom this time instead of a studio as there was 4 of us. Room 213. The 3rd floor was filled, which is the best as it's quieter. This is a small hotel and this is why it's nice. Free parking and off the busy highway 8. They do only have one person working at desk but don't know why other reviews said they were rude. We met 3 of them and they were all very friendly and helpful. We will always go back here as it's great for the $$ and very spacious and small. No walking down long hall ways. There is no swimming pool but there is a outdoor jacquizzi, did not use it.

Reviews.Title: “Large suites, poor showers”
Reviews.Author: Mattiasdad
Reviews.Content: We decided to book this hotel despite the mixed reviews. Pros: - relative proximity to attractions (10 min drive on freeway to downtown) - free parking and free wifi - large suites - relatively clean rooms - full kitchen (fridge, range, microwave and dishwasher) Cons: - poor shower facilities (sufficient heat and water pressure, but the "water saving" shower heads are a disgrace!!! ). Instead of a quick shower, we ended up re-cleaning the tub and drawing hot bathes, wasting more water than we originally would have used... - slightly dated and worn furnishing - the single elevator not working on the day of checkout (3 flights of stairs and luggage to deal with) The shower head was the big buzz killer. Fix it and we might recommend for its relative value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in hotel circle area”
Reviews.Author: SFTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property a few weeks ago. The front desk was very friendly and helpful, the room was a one bedroom suite and was quite large, furniture was a bit dated but still ok, it had a kitchenette and the bedroom was at the rear of the property so it was quiet for sleeping as the front of the unit faces the street and the freeway beyond that. I had no problems with noise. The breaksfast in the morning was standard faire but was servicable. The price for the suite was very reasonable. All in all I would stay there again on a future trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DAG-5YrPlan
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal on Priceline for this hotel, which was fairly close to the airport. The hotel however is not walking distance to any restaurants or bars. The room was very large; it was a suite after all and would be great if planning an extended stay. The furniture and fixtures are a little worn, but all in all it was a nice, clean room for the price.

Reviews.Title: “'Suite' ? Did I miss something?”
Reviews.Author: TroyMusil
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 3am in the morning after a long day of driving. And the front desk was closed! what kind of hotel closes there front desk? so after half hour of waiting someone finally shows up. Then they mixed up our reservations and had to re-due everything. Didnt end up getting to the room until after 4am. Not happy. Business in the morning so I had to get up at 6. But there is NO HOT WATER! I called front desk and lady was very sarcastic and said im going to have to "deal with it" until 11 when the manager gets in. So I was not happy at all, thats ok, ill go get breakfast. What a cheap and terrible breakfast it was in a tiny room. I had to go meet my brother who was arriving back state-side from military over seas deployment that morning. We get back and on top of everything, the internet doesnt work! REDICULOUS. ive never complained about a hotel, but this was God-Aweful. and to call yourself 'Suites' your out of your mind. Then for a little Icing on the cake, my brother got charged for the room, and so did I. we stayed 2 nights, and bother got charged for 2 nights. I only get refunded for 1 night. Unbelievable. In all seriousness, the rooms were nice, but the rest of the place is garbage. seems to me like they spent all there money on the rooms and didnt have enough to accommodate all the other standards. And customer service is some of the worst ive ever gotten in my entire life. not exaggerating at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay, over all great hotel for your money!”
Reviews.Author: taylor b
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to San Diego this month and our last stay was a unsatisfying and the hotel was a dump! (ramada inn San Diego south) well this time was a different experience entirely! Hawthorn suites is a little difficult to find like other reviewers stated but hotel circle is all hotels so theyre all right next to each other it could get confusing but its not anything to complain about because if you know what you're looking for it shouldn't be a problem. The water pressure was the only thing to complain about, at least in room 216 you're better off taking a bath, plenty of hot water though! Other reviews complained about running out so I was worried but it was endless for me, and my 2 other family members. The toilet flushed weird and the sink drained a little slow. But nothing inconvenient. The room is big! Plenty of room for an entire family. The fold out couch wasn't as uncomfortable as I assumed it'd be and the bed was so comfortable! Great pillows and blanket. Very clean as all, the entire room was cleaned well. Hotel staff is great! So friendly and breakfast was good! It's a buffet. And like with any hotel, get there early to get the best food and variety (that's obvious and shouldn't be complained about, you cannot expect to show up 5 mins before it's over and get what you want) They also have coffee available 24/7 it seems. Laundry is available. No pool, but there is a jacuzzi. Vending machines down stairs, free wifi, flat screen tv, computer downstairs in lobby for use along with printer. Over all good experience, I will stay again, so close to sdsu for anyone coming to visit their children it's a convenient location! Best deal too ( I booked thru priceline bid now option) I save over 20$ a night and they had a stay three night save deal. 80$ a night plus tax of course is what I paid for Thursday-Sunday. Check out time is noon, which gives you plenty of time. Definitely worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, spacious suite on the inside. Crusty on the outside.”
Reviews.Author: CinSpinSugar
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell, I gave this place four stars for the room and staff friendliness, no fort the property as a whole. The common amenities are a bit of a joke- the "pool" was more of a tub of water. "Complimentary breakfast" consisted of like two cereals, a waffle maker with batter provided, and coffee in a small room. (Tip: The Double Tree next door has a great breakfast buffet). There is no restaurant on the premisses, but the front desk will kindly provide you with affordable delivery options. The exterior needs renovation, but the rooms inside are nice. I had a one bedroom suite which far exceeded my expectations and ultimately left me feeling very pleased. There was a fairly spacious living room with a kitchenette and two tvs in the suite. There wasn't a full partition between the "bedroom" and the living room. Even though they are a bit separated, there's no true privacy between the two areas. I found this layout to be quite nice, but this may not be what you're expecting. The free wi-fi worked well and I found myself to be very comfortable in the room. For some reason my reservation through a third party site did not show up in the hotel's system when I checked a week before my arrival. The manager was more than helpful in creating a new reservation and offering my the same discount as the other site. I would definitely stay there again and recommend this place to anyone who cares more about what's inside the room than outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Highly recommended. Certainly will be back”
Reviews.Author: HYKE_HYER
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our short trip to san diego. This hotel is about 3mi from the SD Zoo and few miles from Gas Lamp, Midway etc... It cant get better location-wise. The staff is very courteous. They serve super fresh breakfast every morning too. The room service is excellent. Unfortunately or fortunately no room for complaints !

Reviews.Title: “YIKES!”
Reviews.Author: 1laughlin
Reviews.Content: This past weekend, we traveled to San Diego for our twin boyâ€™s college graduation ceremonies at UCSD. Since there were several family members attending we need rooms large enough to accommodate everyone and lots of stuff for the busy weekend. I was thrilled to receive a great price through priceline.com (name your own price) and figured it wouldn't be perfect but the price was. To even find the Hawthorne suites took an act of congress as the property sits behind two other properties. Their tiny sign is located adjacent to a very narrow road which leads up to the property. After a few drive-bys, we finally found it. First thing we noticed when we approached their main entrance were employees smoking right by the front door. I guess they don't have a smoking area for their employees. I loved it when we opened our room door and was greeted to a giant discolored stain on the carpet. It looked like someone had dumped bleach on it :-) Ok, whatever. However, I was thrilled with the sight of black hair in the bathtub. I ran down to the front desk to retrieve a container of comet so I could clean the tub. There are certain things I won't trust to others once they have screwed it up, like me booking this place for family members. Ok, whatever. Now I'm assuming the beds were from the stone ages, probably from the Fred Flintstone era because they were as comfortable as sleeping on rocks. After messing around with the air conditioner we assumed it didn't work. However the following day when we returned it was like walking into a giant sub-zero refrigerator. If you decide to stay here give your A/C at least 24 hours to turn on or request a manual from the front desk for detailed instructions. In all fairness, we didn't spend much time in our room and the breakfast was ok as reported by my mother-in law. The rooms are very large and basically clean except for our nasty tub. The property itself could use lots of new paint and carpet. A gardener and a broom would be a welcome sight and proper signage should be a must. However, I really enjoyed the staff at the front desk. They had printed directions to anywhere you may want to go in San Diego. Their staff recommended great restaurants. And I was very impressed with the fact they sent a bottle of wine to a woman I meet in the Jacuzzi because her daughter was in the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catsandra
Reviews.Content: This hotel is next to the Doubletree and sits in the back of the other hotels which is more secluded and quite instead of being right next to the freeway. My husband and I were very impressed with the price that we paid. The lobby is very pretty and clean and the staff is excellent. The room, of course, is older but very roomy, clean and updated. The kitchen, we were in the studio, was awesome with all the amenties and for going out to eat and having a refrig. is very good, as I always have leftovers. The bed was very comfortable and everything very clean. Only 3 floors and of course elevators. Breakfast had the waffle maker, cold cereal, apples, muffins, eggs,sausage and potatoes. Two major shopping centers across the freeway winthin a mile. Will return on my next visit for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Yucky, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Designerbarb
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. Everything is old and yucky except the bed was newer and fairly comfortable. The carpet was frayed and the furniture looked like it came from Goodwill. How this place got the name Wyndham on it I will never know. Every other Wyndham hotel I have stayed at was very nice--they sure fooled me on this one. Service was very poor. I had to complain to three different people at the front desk for two days in a row before they fixed my TV remote which didn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Nice large suite”
Reviews.Author: 3bear
Reviews.Content: After our cruise we wanted to stay longer to visit the museum of natural history in Balboa park. This hotel is located on hotel circle near the park. The suite photo on the web was a little different than the one we chose,it is your choice of a wall separate from the bedroom or not. We chose no wall. Choose wall for privacy when traveling with others, or just use bathroom for changing.The room is large with full kitchen-- pots,dishes tableware, glasses,coffee cups,dish soap,coffee pot, and of course,stove/refer/microwave. Separate living room with sofa and comfy chair with cable TV. We had 2 beds also with another TV there.There was only one shampoo in bathroom and spa is outside (cold weather/night temps concern). Nice place, and feels good. Good location on hill overlooking the surrounding hills and only one exit to the 163 to Balboa park. San Diego is expensive but I feel it is a good price-value considering what is out there. Very nice check in staff!! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awful service with the company of ants”
Reviews.Author: flemingant
Reviews.Content: es we took a family holiday to California stayed in Santa Monica then traveled down to San Diego, almost missed the sign for Hawthorne suites which is up behind several hotels on the main road. Very strange layout of suite, you walk into the room which is the bedroom then the kitchen/toilet area then into the lounge area, weird to say the least. The taps were not working properly which we reported the first day, were not fixed, then towards the end of the 6 day stay we started noticing ants in the cupboards above the sink. Free Wi-fi and parking are probably the only good things going for this hotel, breakfast was just OK if you could get a seat in the very small breakfast area. NOT RECOMMENDED!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't do it again”
Reviews.Author: poco01x
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel and found the "suite" somewhat cramped, but doable. After a night in the bed that felt like it was stuffed with corncobs and potatos, asked to upgrade to a larger room. The lady at the front desk was very pleasant and accomodating, and with her help, moved to a larger room. The bed here was much better, but the furniture was ripped and dirty, with a broken lamp sitting at an drunken angle. Breakfast was eggs every day, which might have been ok, if they were edible. Over cooked, and heard several guests say they were terrible. All in all, pick a nicer place to stay, the weather was nice so we didn't have to spend much time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Minimum Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tarzanldy
Reviews.Content: We had a coupon for a free night which made this hotel acceptable in that we didn't have to pay. It was clean and that was indeed important. It is tucked in to the mountain above hotel circle which is a disaster of noise. The suite area was interesting in that you entered the bedroom in order to get to the living room. The bedroom was facing a mountain and an outside walkway. We were woken up at 4am due to guests talking loudly on the balcony. The breakfast was decent but this is shocking...there was no coffee or tea service!! Other guests ran to Starbucks but we just grabbed a few items and left. The "pool/spa" was a hole and it was green. Stay with caution!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: AustinTrainRider
Reviews.Content: It is a wonderful hotel !! we took the 2 bedroom/2bath suites in 2nd floor - the room was at the bottom of the hill - wonderful view of flowers. This place have huge big rooms - our 2 bedroom suite felt like a big apartment. I strongly recommend this place. The price was really good. They have nice big kitchen w/ refrigerator & microwave. Our stay was really good. We were 4 adults and 3 kids - I recommend this hotel for big families with kids. Breakfast was good - hotel staff was very friendly. I called them earlier for 2nd floor and got it after arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Enormous room - a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: SamuelFamilyof6
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 6 (2 adults, 4 children (11, 10, 6 and 3)) travelling around California. We stayed at the Hawthorn for 2 nights in order to see some of San Diego. It has a good location for visiting some of San Diego's sights especially the Old Town which is literally 5 minutes away. The front desk staff were friendly and gave some good recommendations for eating in the Old Town (Casa Guadalajara was excellent!). The Suite was truly massive with high ceilings, 2 bathrooms, 1 bedroom with a king, another annex from the living area with a queen and a big double sofa bed. Plenty of room for us. BUT and there are a few buts. Disappointing that there is only a spa and not a pool. We knew about this beforehand, but thought that we could use the pool of the adjoining hotel - however, we were told we couldn't and in any event, it was a bit of a trek to the next door hotel. There were no towels by the spa either. Breakfast was OK - but nothing special and finished at 9 (pretty early when you're on holiday!). We asked for a quiet room at the back (after reading reviews on this site). Our room was at the back, but the living room (which also had the sofa bed and queen annex) faced the main road. This is where the children were and it did disturb them. Overall, I think OK value for money. I would recommend this hotel for the size of rooms but with a health warning about the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, but mixed review”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette1
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for two nights. I had booked a "queen suite." I was very surprised to find that the bed was not in a separate bedroom, but rather in an alcove off the main room. I guess it never said that it was separate on their website, but I feel it's misleading to call this type of room a "suite." I must say that the room was huge. We were on the second floor, and the room almost felt cavernous, with high ceilings. The furnishings are pretty basic but fine. There's a spa but no pool (can use the one at a nearby hotel). The young man at the reception desk was very helpful when we arrrived with car trouble, directing us to a repair facility and providing a map. Other staff seemed not as helpful. While there is a sign in the bathroom saying not to take the towels to the spa as there are towels provided there, this proved not to be the case, and we had to walk back to our room dripping wet and cold. When we mentioned this to the front desk, their only response was, "Oh, we had to move them to the front desk, as they kept disappearing." I would think they could modify the signs in the bathroom or add a small sign at the front desk. Also, after we had checked out, my daughter realized she had left her camera charger plugged into an outlet. She called the hotel multiple times about it, but no one ever called back. Breakfast was OK - fruit cocktail (not fresh fruit), scrambled eggs and bacon, cereal, bagels. Waffles were good the one day that the waffle iron was there. The breakfast area is small. There's a large sign at the area entrance saying it's not allowed to take food from the area. This doesn't strike me as very friendly, especially when there's not enough space to eat in the breakfast room. Why not allow it, as Residence Inn does, both as a guest convenience and to free up space. The hotel location is good. While it's on busy Hotel Circle, it's set back from the street up against a hillside, so is very quiet, and convenient to all area attractions. All in all, an OK place and a good value but service could use some work.

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly deceived ... but expected more luxury”
Reviews.Author: Saintor
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite with non-smoking preference. We got the apology that all non-smoking ones were taken. What are reservations for? Honestly, the suite was not too smelly, even if there was some smoking there. Not much space for breakfast. It was roomy and quiet. Free parking, breakfast and wireless internet is welcomed. A very good value, but it is not new.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised and VERY convenient”
Reviews.Author: rossy53
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised many times by the difference between my perception of a hotel vs. others' perceptions. Reading the reviews on this hotel made me a bit cautious, but my wife and I decided to try it nonetheless. We arrived at the hotel at 2:20 p.m. on Christmas Day - not always the best day to rate a hotel since many staff are not thrilled to be at work to begin with. Robert, the desk manager, was a delight! He made me and my wife feel very welcome. Our room was worth FAR more than what we paid, based on numerous trips to San Diego. Wireless was fine - and plenty fast for us and our son. It wasn't blazing but I'm not at a hotel to download Handle's Messiah, so who cares? The jacuzzi was nice, the "shared" pool (with another hotel) was more than adequate; the food was plentiful and outstanding. The only SMALL negative was the gym: the weight machine ad elliptical were broken.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location,huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: matmanf27
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night but i must say this place had the most comfortable of all the beds in our 3 week trip. location was perfect for us and the rooms were huge with all the amenities you needed. did not have a pool but the hot spa was a welcome change and thoroughly enjoyed. Complimentary breakfast was fantastic and the kids loved making their own waffles. pity we only spent a night here.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better...”
Reviews.Author: green_spark
Reviews.Content: HUGE, clean room - but don't stay in 117 - lingering food odors. I borrowed room freshener spray from the front desk, but to no avail. Free wi-fi in the room, but VERY SLOW. Kitchenette had a 2-burner stove and a mini-microwave. Vending machines in the lobby sell Hot Pockets (very convenient for late night check-ins). Took some plates out of the cupboard to heat up my Hot Pocket, and they were ALL wet - that was disgusting. Altho online images give the impression that the hotel has interior hallways, access is from exterior hallways. Flat-screen t.v. in the living area, but the picture quality was very poor. Only 23 cable channels to choose from. There's no DVD player in the unit.

Reviews.Title: “Worst BED ever !!”
Reviews.Author: LuckySassie
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a very long day of flying and delay's at airports and were extremely tired and exhausted. Checking in was easy and the girl checking us in was friendly and accomidating. It was late and we walked into a one bedroom suite,very clean and looked inviting. Looked inviting until we hit the bed. This bed was the worst bed we have ever encountered anywhere. The queen size bed had a well worn place in the center and we both sunk promptly to the middle. We'd start out on the edge of the bed which has a immediate slope to the center. Waking up with a sore back from lack of support is not exactly what we called a good nights sleep. The couch and floor were more pleasant to sleep on then what they call a bed. I can only describe the bed as something you would find on a curb somewhere. Room # 214. We are used to a good firm mattress and this was not a firm matteress at all. The maid has not emptied out our trash under the sink yet and this is our 2nd week here.It isn't stinky so she will have to do it when we check out. The air conditioner is great as it cools the living room very well but, the bedroom has a wall that the air has to go around to cool the bedroom off. Ice machine broke and we had to go to the front desk and ask them to get us ice for about five or six days .They had to unlock this little dining area to get the ice. That's when we felt attitude from the staff. You could tell they felt it was a bother to them. Not all of them,the young bald man late in the evening was very kind. The reason we did not change rooms or demand something worthy of the price we paid is my husbands company has only a few places he can stay. The restraunts within walking distance are excellent,a little expensive but the food is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: WaipahuTraveler
Reviews.Content: The room we booked was large (1-bedroom suite) and well-appointed. Full efficiency kitchen, a nice flat-panel tv in the living room, and it was very clean. The living room was huge. We had 3 suitcases wide open all the time and they never got in the way. Try that in a standard hotel room. Only 50 units in this complex so there was never a mob scene during check-in or check-out. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Conveniently located in a quiet setting on a hillside. Right in Hotel Circle so getting to/from places was a snap. The continental breakfast was a cut above the usual continental fare. Free parking and an exercise room to boot. We stayed there 6 nights and felt we were in a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Beware-Their mistakes, your credit card”
Reviews.Author: hleigh19
Reviews.Content: My dad booked two rooms at the Hawthorn Suites through Expedia. When we arrived for a late check-in we were told, by the exceptionally rude and unprofessional woman on the front desk, that Expedia had overbooked them and that we were going to be sent to their sister-site down the street. We had booked two King suites with kitchenettes. We were told the rooms we were getting were standards with two double beds and no kitchenette. We could also see the sister location from their site. It looked dirty and run-down. We argued vehemently that this was not what we had booked, that they had weeks to notify us of the mistake, and that they needed to release us from the reservation. The girl at the desk seemed apathetic and put-out that we were making a fuss. We even called Expedia, but the hotel insisted they were offering us a comparable room. COMPARABLE!?! Charging us for King beds and kitchens and giving us doubles down the street is not quite comparable in my mind. Even American Express was not able to remedy the situation because the hotel continued to lie and insist that they had given a comparable option. To make matters even more disgusting, a man who was checking in as we arrived came back down while we were still arguing and said that he was checking out because the room was filthy and unacceptable. The woman at the desk, without looking at the room or offering to send housekeeping through, said we could have that one. We declined... The only good thing about this hotel was that we used the lobby computer's internet access to book rooms at a different hotel. My poor dad ending up having to pay nearly four hundred dollars for the "cancelled" reservation on top of the cost of the new hotel. Worst service we have ever received!!! We have no intentions of ever attempting to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lisam0198
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hawthorn Suites with my husband and another couple from May 30th - June 6th. It was wonderful! We had a two bedroom suite which worked out well except the bedroom off of the living room didn't have a door but we made do. The rooms are really large and the bed and pillows were comfortable. The rooms themselves were kind of basic so if you are looking for something that looks pretty this isn't the hotel but they were very clean and comfortable for us. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful when it came to recommendations. The exercise room needs some attention though. I didn't go myself but my husband went and quickly came back disappointed. We didn't try the pool but it looked nice and clean. The water pressure in the bathroom was good and it was nice having two bathrooms. Overall I would definitely stay again and for $108 a night we couldn't beat the price anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a great room and hot breakfast”
Reviews.Author: CiciOakland
Reviews.Content: I frequently attend a conference in hotel circle and refuse to stay at the sponsor hotel. I decided to give Hawthorne Suites a try. For the same group discount rate as the conference hotel my group was staying at, I got a much larger, newer room, with a kitchenette, an excellent hot breakfast (not just pastries and fruit), a workout room, and a very comfortable bed in a quiet room. They also have a hot tub and pool. I appreciate the fact that it is back off the freeway farther than the other hotels so I didn't get the traffic noise. My classmates were jealous that they missed out on all the extras for the same price as their run down motel!

Reviews.Title: “Hawthorn Suites San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dlew2k
Reviews.Content: This region is overpriced to begin with. After searching Orbitz and finding a decent price for a Mission Valley' Hotel Circle suite room... Not bad for $$$.$$ !!! Clean and spacious room with all the amenities one needs for a suite room. Smiling staff members and good cleaning effort from housekeeping... i can appreciate their efforts.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation but was charged anyway.”
Reviews.Author: human1138
Reviews.Content: I cancelled my reservation a week before i was supposed to arrive and the hotel still charged $500 to my credit card. I called the hotel staff 5 times, talked to different people, left messages and they promised to take care of it but never did. Finally, after almost two months of frustration I got my credit card company involved and the charge was magically removed. Terrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great price”
Reviews.Author: ssqqhh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hawthorn Suites Hotel from April 16 - 25. We got a one bedroom suite and have 3 children under the age of 7. The price was great! I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews here but I must say this hotel definitely lived up to our expectations. The only "problem" we had was the lady who checked us in was a bit rude. I did mention this website to her though and she became instantly nicer! The room was a good size. The kids slept on the sofa bed which was not comfortable at all until we took the mattress out and put it on the floor to get it to lie flat. The sofa is just very old and worn and those springs would not have been comfortable to sleep on! The furniture is all dated and could use an update but we were hardly in the room so it did not bother us. The one thing in the room that was very gross was the bathtub. It was dirty and stained and definitely needs to be replaced. The breakfast each morning was excellent and very well re-stocked. They were constantly replenishing everything and there was a large variety of food. The people at the fronty desk greeted my kids every day with a huge smile and a warm hello and were helpful anytime we had questions or needed anything. My huisband used the exercise room and said there were a variety of machines and it was well kept. We did go to the grocery store and cooked in the room on a few days. One thing I did not realize was there is no oven in the room. We bought something that needed to be cooked in the oven and when we realized it, the front desk told us to bring it down and they cooked it for us in their kitchen! The housekeeping did a great job cleaning our kitchen every day for us as well. The location is great as its super easy to get right on the freeway and get to where you need to go. It is close to everything. We felt safe the entire time we were there. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel and would definitely stay again if we're in the area. It is not a place you'd want to go if you plan to spend most of your time relaxing in the hotel but if you need a place to eat, shower and sleep this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: VAMPIREWOMAN
Reviews.Content: This is great place though not "POSH"...Recently stayed here for 7 days... Suite rooms are absolutely HUGE. You feel more like you are in an apartment rather than a hotel. Kitchen area is wonderful with frig-range top-microwave & dishwasher. Bathroom is large but only has single sink area. Hotel was extremely quiet plus nice views of the "Hills". Complimentary breakfast is awesome. Buffet style with great variety=eggs,bacon,sausage,biscuitsgravy,potatoes,waffles,cereals,pastries,fresh fruits & much more!! Hotel staff were some of the nicest I have met during my travels. But Guest Attendent Robert Sander stands out above all-this gentlemen is a "GEM". You won't be able not to fall in love with Robert!! Great restaurant within walking distance called "The Valley Kitchen"-good homestyle cooking & great prices. There is mall area within 5-10 min. drive where you can find a Target store. Here we bought mutli grocery products at great prices.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation experience”
Reviews.Author: ThanksHawthorne
Reviews.Content: We had 3 adults and 1 child staying at the Hawthorne and the experience was wonderful. Our check in was competent & friendly, the day before Thanksgiving. Throughout the stay, the manager (Robert) gave us directions, information and a cheerful smile. The room was clean and HUGE, enough room for a 6-year old to stretch out! The biggest plus was 2 TVs so one could be playing cartoons or movie and the other one had football. This Inn is located centrally so we had very little travel time to Balboa, Midway and the Museums. I love it and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware Ifyou Cancel Reservations”
Reviews.Author: onlnmom
Reviews.Content: My family and I were planning on staying here during Thanksgiving weekend, but plans changed so we canceled our reservations. Monday after Thanksgiving we reviewed our account and saw a charge for a nights stay at the Hawthorne Suites, they charged us for a night even after we had cancelled it. Luckily I had canceled on line because I had a cancellation number. I called Hawthorne Suites and the guy told myself and my mom that the code had been input wrong and that it wasn't showing canceled, but since we had a cancellation number then he would reverse the charges. My whole family has had to call and also call there credit card company to dispute the charges. Please beware if you plan on staying here to make sure if you cancel your reservation that you do it online and keep a record of it or better yet not stay here. They are hoping that no one would catch on to what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price-Value Hotel Convenient to Key San Diego Locations”
Reviews.Author: PSUDanO
Reviews.Content: The Hawthorn Suites is an average hotel (not a bad thing) with a very friendly and helpful staff. I checked in after 8pm and received a friendly greeting and offer of advice where to eat. The rooms are basic but LARGE, with a living room equipped with TV and a nice sofa, a kitchen with a cooktop, microwave and fridge, and decent size bedroom. The matress is so-so, and the bathroom was basically clean though there was some minor mold around the top of the shower. Internet and parking are free; the parking is convenient but the internet is so-so; I got knocked off the wireless internet a couple times in the evening and nighttime bandwith was poor. A big plus over their long-term living competitor and neighbor, Residence Inn; EXCELLENT SOUNDPROOFING! I didn't hear ANYTHING from my neighbors. Free breakfast is good but basic and repetititve; scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage hash browns, etc. Overall, with a rack rate of $126 and corporate rate of $116, a good business value in the San Diego Mission Valley area.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, nice room, needs new staff”
Reviews.Author: gemchicini
Reviews.Content: We had a get together in a suite there for my husbands birthday, I did let the staff, (who by the way were rude and had no personality) know that we would have guests. The front desk person said that would be fine. After the manger called at 10:30 to let me know exactly to the tee how many people I had in the room, we finally moved back to my house, still having to pay the $129. I can say, the room was bog and pretty nice, though outdated, but the service and staff were horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, tasty breakfast & good value”
Reviews.Author: TEW49ers
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a weekend and found the rooms enormous and the hotel a good value compared to pricier San Diego places. Free parking. Quiet rooms. Big, hot breakfast offering waffles, eggs, bacon, potatoes, corned beef hash, cereal, yogurt, toast, coffee, juice, etc. Front desk clerk was friendly and competent. Good location on Hotel Circle, close to Old Town and downtown. Free computer/printer in lobby for printing flight boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and BIGâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: Christina_24
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Hawthorn Suites several times in the past 3 years. I will say that the customer service does need to improve! Although, the staff is inattentive and confused most of the time the hotel rooms are nice and BIG! As long as you donâ€™t have to deal with the staff your stay will be very nice and quiet. I have 2 children ages 9 and 4, the rooms are big enough for them to run around in and still give their father and I peace! With kids itâ€™s nice to have the basic kitchen set upâ€¦fridge, microwave & toaster. The kitchen was useful for small meals/snacks for the kids. I wouldnâ€™t think about using the kitchen to cook a full meal but if you had to I guess it would be fine. The only down fall about this hotel is that it has NO pool for the kids! The beach is just a few miles away and not hard to get to though. All in all, I would recommend this place to anyone with kids. Itâ€™s clean and large enough for a family to stay comfortably. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Declined AAA rates”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for 2 nights. Walked in and was quoted $139 as room rate. When I requested the AAA rate, the clerk told me that this was the AAA rate. However at their website, the AAA rate is $125 while the rack rate is $139. After the first night, I asked if they would match the Double Tree rate of $99, but they declined. So we left and went to the Super8 Mission Valley at $65 per night for 3 nights! Still can't figure out the front desk thinking/policy. Seems they get fixed on the rack rate for walk in clients and stick to it. As a result they lost 3 nights business. Room was disappointing for the rate. On the plus side, it was quiet - about 100yards from the Interstate 8 freeway. Service at breakfast was minimal. Food uninspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much..”
Reviews.Author: climberbabe
Reviews.Content: I expected better from a Hyatt subsidiery (sp?). The rooms are spacious and generally clean. However, the kitchen is only adequate. For a chain that gears itself to long term stayers, a dorm sized refrigerator with a minuscule freezer is hardly sufficient. The staff is ridiculously not customer service oriented. When you walk in the door, they keep their head down and don't greet you. I had a situation needing to be addressed (My husband hadn't added my name to the room yet, so they couldn't give me a key) and they disappeared to the back for 5 minutes (ostensibly to ask a manager something), came back, refused to meet my eyes and resumed a conversation with another staff member! They advertise BBQ grills...but no grill tools. Unless you ask one staffer who tells you that each room has individual sets of tools. This tells me that they don't really know about their hotel and what they offer. We are extending our stay in SD and I would love it if we could move to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Zero for Service/Rude Management”
Reviews.Author: Explorer00
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite large but sparse. The customer service at this hotel is non-existent, however, and the management is downright rude. The hotel also charges a $10 â€œearly check in feeâ€� whether you are 3 hours or 15 minutes before their 3:00 pm check in time. The hotel is not worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant! cannot fault it..”
Reviews.Author: MaryChristmas
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as we have stayed in the location previously and know how easy it is to get around the San Diego area from the hotel circle. The hotel room / suite was fantastic - cannot fault it - room is massive and comfortable, breakfast very good and happy hour another unexpected addition - after staying down the road at the Mission Valley resort we didnt think we could beat that - but this was just great.. I would recommend this hotel to anyone - fantastic price rooms easily suit a family or just a couple and all at the one price including food and drink! can't be bad.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, not exciting”
Reviews.Author: RarelyTravelGal
Reviews.Content: The room is relatively large and open. You could really live here for a time if you were so inclined. It is sparsely decorated. It is clean, the walls are white, and the furniture and counters are dark green--relatively stark looking. Our microwave was not clean. We did not cook in the room, so did not try the appliances. The buffet breakfast is very good, has everything from eggs to waffles to fruit to cereal.

Reviews.Title: “Outrageaous price $240, louzy service”
Reviews.Author: etnphone
Reviews.Content: I stayed with 2 adults and 2 kids in this hotel on 8-9 July 2006 Very expensive last-minute of $240 for 1 night, and much worse than any other hotel we visited the past weeks in Southern California. From my earlier experience I expected all hotels on Hotel Circle to have pools, so this was the first hotel we DIDN'T ask: "Do you have a pool" And promptly, this hotel has NO pool Breakfast was served in an empty suite, no restaurant or so Management stopped giving fruit at breakfast (probably too healthy) and how could we expect syrup with the breakfast waffles, they only started serving waffles 2 days ago! Apparently not enough time to buy some syrup... Front desk staff told me that management is too greedy to place some WiFi boosters around the hotel, so even at the reception the WiFi signal was 'Very Low' Most of the time we had no WiFi in the room which was a reason to checkout early to go to the Residence Inn next door to do our daily online work. Front desk staff seemed very frustrated by the great number of complaints they got. They was not interested, unpolite and rude. Apparently they could dream our complaints already If you can get this hotel for $50 or less, just take it and expect nothing But the $240 we had to pay was outrageous and very well overpaid.. Mr.Ad Latjes www.AdLatjes.com

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, free wireless & parking, what else is needed?”
Reviews.Author: smerikal
Reviews.Content: This was a very positive surprise after reading all the previous reviews here (yet I booked this because it was reasonable 99$, available and had a good location). I had no trouble with the hotel voucher and the front desk was very helpful. The room was the biggest I've ever seen on any hotel, like a big two room apartment with a full size couch, two television sets, own kitchen (with forks, plates etc. provided). HUGE. Everything was clean and comfortable except I that I couldn't figure out a way to fully open the windows. A huge plus was the free wireless that worked flawlessly, but I got the impression also other hotels in the region offered that. Parking was free, plenty and felt safe. The hotel was nicely situated a bit above the street and the room was thus very quiet. Breakfast was included but nothing special, or actually quite weird for my European taste (sausages, omelette, chili) but could serve well 'truck driver' types trying to survive with it through the day. This hotel would be great for families or groups of friends on long stays. I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Rude Manager, Incompetent Staff, Overbooking Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I called the reservation center on Monday, March 20, 2006 to reserve a suite for March 31, 2006 â€“ April 2, 2006. I used my credit card to guarantee the room. On Wednesday, March 22, 2006, I phoned the hotel to verify my reservation and learned that the hotel had overbooked, and that my reservations were not confirmed. I phoned guest services and spoke with Sue, who was extremely helpful, who phoned the hotel and connected me with Darryl, the district manager. He was adamant that I could not be reimbursed for the error. In his opinion, it wasnâ€™t the fault of the hotel. After speaking with him for a few minutes, he reluctantly agreed to have the front desk manager, Lourdes, seek comparable hotel rooms in San Diego and follow up with me before the end of the business day. On Friday, March 24, 2006, two business days later, Lourdes sent me an e-mail and suggested I make a reservation with the Residence Inn San Diego. (I made a reservation with the Residence Inn prior to her suggestion as I had not heard back from the staff at Hawthorn and wanted a guaranteed reservation.) On Tuesday, March 28, 2006, I contacted Darryl to learn the details of their reservation guarantee policy. The policy notes that Hawthorn must pay the full cost of the first nightâ€™s lodging if a suite or room is not available because of an unintentional error. Additionally the staff should make every effort to find accommodations for me at a nearby Hawthorn, or a comparable hotel and pay the cost of a telephone call to notify your home or office of your change in accommodations. Darryl was incorrigible. He was vehemently against paying for the first nightâ€™s stay because he felt that the error was not done by the hotel. Furthermore, he stated that his staff had done enough by referring me to another hotel although the above referenced policy states that it is their responsibility to do so. I expected a much higher level of service from Hawthorn and am very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: Brown-2004
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights using Hyatt Gold points and what a mistake. They could not confirm our reservation because they do not have E Mail!! Phoned ahead day of arrival and was told they would have a room ready at 11:30. Arrived at 12noon and were told no room until at least 1:30 and no rooms as requested on the top floor. Finally we were given a handicaped room at 2:30 with no tub. Only 10 Channels of TV and there is no pool. The light in our bathroom was flickering and almost out so we reported this to the desk at 3PM and it was fixed at 5:30PM THE NEXT DAY! Happy Hour is a joke with a few cans of beer and a couple of cheap bottles of wine and no snacks like nuts or popcorn. Not sufficient room at breakfast so some familys sat outside in the cold. Two toasters and only one worked in one slot etc. There is no fitness or business center. Both the bed and the sofa squeeked and had poor springs. We found the staff very inefficient and generally a couldn't careless attitude prevailed

Reviews.Title: “Good value for San Diego”
Reviews.Author: treschichomme
Reviews.Content: I understand the complaints--I've stayed there three times now, twice on business and once with my son, and the first time my reservation was completely wiped out of the computer. However, on every occasion the rooms have been clean and spacious, the staff in the breakfast room agreeable and the hottub enjoyable. Their staff is not always the best trained or most sophisticated, but if you approach them in a friendly and respectful manner I think you find that they will reciprocate for the most part. Its obvious they are saving money on staffing, but this did not detract from my stay. Especially if you compare the rates at this hotel with much older, less clean ones nearby, you will find this place a relative bargain. Families seem especially to enjoy themselves here; I met one from Chile who seemed quite pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for us!”
Reviews.Author: Kelgee
Reviews.Content: After reading some recent reviews I was a bit leery regarding our 4 night stay. Basically, for the money ($89 per night)it's a nice value. A large spacious suite, free breakfast w/eggs, sausage, waffles, toast and fruit (not the best quality, but it worked). The room was clean and quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful. When your spending a couple hundred dollars a day at Sea World, Legoland, the zoo etc. it's nice to save a few bucks on the room and breakfast. Free access to a nearby health club made me feel a bit better about the tasty Mexican food we porked out on every night in old town. A couple of small issues; upon arrival my reservation was nowhere to be found! Even though I made it more than a month in advance and called to confirm two days in advance. The girl behind the desk explained that "corporate and their location don't communicate very well" Duh! I would book through the hotel directly. Also, the queen bed has seen better days, hopefully it's about to be changed out, although it wasn't to the point of an uncomfortable nights sleep, yet. If you want some room to stretch out on a budget, check it out. Remember, you don't always get what you pay for, here you certainly do.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but not a vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACAgo
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and we did get a non smoking room. The furniture was worn and the beds were in need of replacement. They did not even have a pop machine but were getting one. We did not stay for the breakfast, but looked okay. When on vacation would stay somewhere nicer next time. I have stayed at other Hawthorn Suites that were newer and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel and Management-Avoid this at all costs!”
Reviews.Author: rocketmanUs
Reviews.Content: We had booked 3 separate rooms through the Hawthorn Suites web site for three of us on a business trip. All rooms were requested non-smoking. When we arrived today at approx. 3:00pm, the parking lot was empty, the lobby was empty, but the clerk at the desk said they did not have any non smoking rooms. I travel weekly for business and have periodically had this happen to me when I check in to a hotel late at night or during a convention, but none of this applied. One of my colleagues actually did check in and went up to her room to find it terribly dated, dirty and with a bed visibly sagging. She came back down to the lobby, very dissatisfied. I continued to press the desk clerk for a non-smoking room and she voluntarilly said she could put me in a non smoking two room suite. I told her this would be fine. She then disappeared into the back room and came back with a change in the rate from $87 to $159 a night because of the "room upgrade". I explained to her that this was unacceptable and I would only pay the rate which I guaranteed to my credit card. She again went in the back and came back with an older man in street clothes who then accused me of making his employee cry. At this point I told him in my 15 years of weekly travel, I have never encountered this. I am a Diamond Level member in Hyatt's Gold Passport program (of which Hawthorn participates). In the end, he was extremely rude and refused to honor the rate or provide a non-smoking room. We then cancelled all three of our reservations and moved to a much nicer property. Bottom line-avoid this hotel. From the management's lack of basic service apptitude to the dire condition of their rooms-you can do much better than the Hawthorn Suites San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend - We actually only stayed 20 minutes”
Reviews.Author: OandO
Reviews.Content: We booked this room because of the great rate. However, when we got there, the staff was working with a customer complaint and made us wait for 15 minutes. She was rude and didn't even acknowlege that I had been waiting there...all ready to get settled in with my 2 tired toddlers. When it was my turn, she was also very rude and offered me a smoking room. Tired and desparate, we accepted the room. We walked through a dark alley to get there and then opened the door and the cigarette smoke was so overwhelming that we had to leave and find another hotel. The front desk person said she would not charge us but at the same time refused to give us any confirmation that my credit card was not billed. It was just horrible, with unprofessional service.

Reviews.Title: “Self Service”
Reviews.Author: tangster
Reviews.Content: Checked in after driving from Phoenix on October 9, 2005. Discovered that besides the front desk clerk, there wasn't any other staff on the premises to provide assistance. My wife and three kids were given a third floor suite that proved sparse and dated. There wasn't enough towels or pillows for our family. Since there wasn't any other staff on site, I had to take the elevator down to the front lobby to pick up extra towels and was told no extra pillows were available. How can a hotel run out of pillows? There parking lot was only a third full. In addition, I needed a crib and they charged me an extra $5, plus I had to lug the thing up to the 3rd floor myself and set it up as well. To top it off, the single pillow I had to sleep on was flat as a pancake. Didn't have a fitful sleep at all. On top of it all, I heard every person walking outside my front door. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! rooms are huge.”
Reviews.Author: jcsheng505
Reviews.Content: After Disneyland we headed to San Diego and stayed at Hawthorn Suites. My wife and I and the kids were amazed how big the rooms are, we all loved it. After a day at Seaworld coming back to the room was very relaxing. We didnt feel cramped in like a regular hotel room. There was enough room where we all had a little space to unwind and relax. We came during the first week of Oct so the hotel was not that busy, got a good nite sleep evey night. The small kitchen was nice. The frig was great for keeping left overs. Free Wifi was also nice as I get up earlier than the rest of the family so I am on my laptop in the kitchen area. During Mon-Thurs they have happy hour where you can get free drinks. The free hot breakfast was a time saver for my family. While each of us got ready at different times, we just went downstairs and got breakfast. There are plenty of resturants up and down Hotel Circle, there is also a shopping center near by has places to eat. Overall my family and I loved this hotel and the prices was right. We will stay here again in our future trips to Seaworld and the Zoo.

HotelInfo.Name: Hawthorn Suites by Wyndham San Diego
HotelInfo.Address: 1335 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
